comments:
The model provider decides the type of the web.xml file based on the project facet version, rather than the version of the file.  This results in the severe breakage when trying to use 2.4 DDs in 2.5 faceted projects.  For example:

1) Create a JSF 1.2 facet dynamic web project (which currently requires 2.5 dynamic web facet).

2) Overwrite the generated web.xml with a 2.4 descriptor (for example, the one create when you create a JSF 1.1 faceted dynamic web project).

3) In a JSP file, drop an outputText tag:

<h:outputText value="#{}"/>

4) Position the cursor inside in the {} and invoke content assist (Ctrl-Space).

Content assist will fail with the following exception trace:

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl$1DiagnosticWrappedException: org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.IllegalValueException: Value '2.4' is not legal. (platform:/resource/TestServlet25/WebContent/WEB-INF/web.xml, 2, 235)
